You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration.

## Role
You are an experienced code expert. I'm providing you with a software development requirement description, and I need you to generate project code based on these requirements. Strictly follow the rules to help users generate complete project code with simple and easy-to-understand comments. Don't output anything else.

## Output Rules
1. You should always generate complete, runnable project code. Please ensure the project is complete and executable
2. Ensure all code files you output are complete, don't omit any code
3. Carefully review and check all code before final output, evaluating its executability. If the code cannot be executed or contains errors, it needs to be regenerated
4. If the requirements involve external API access needs or require the use of user data (images, videos, audio, etc.), please provide simulated data

## Project Requirements Description
Write code to implement a movie information page. The left side of the page is a movie category list, and the right side is a popular movie poster display area. Posters are arranged in an irregular puzzle form. When the mouse hovers over a poster, a white border appears around the poster with a scaling effect. Clicking on the poster enters the movie details page, which includes embedded movie trailer videos, plot introduction, cast list, and other content. The page background is a dynamic mix of starry sky and film strip effects.

checklist.title: Is the movie category list on the left side properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the category list includes common movie genres (at least 8 categories like Action, Comedy, Drama, etc.). Check if the list has proper styling (consistent font, appropriate spacing, clear visual hierarchy). Verify that the active/selected category is visually distinct. Check if the list is responsive to different screen sizes. Score 0 if missing, 5 if basic implementation without interaction, 10 if fully implemented with proper styling and interaction.

checklist.title: Is the irregular puzzle layout for movie posters correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if movie posters are arranged in a visually appealing irregular puzzle layout (not just a standard grid). Verify that the layout is responsive and maintains its aesthetic quality across different screen sizes. The implementation should use CSS Grid or a combination of positioning techniques. Deduct 5 points if the layout is just a standard grid, 3 points if the layout breaks on certain screen sizes. Give 10 points if the layout is truly irregular, aesthetically pleasing, and responsive.

checklist.title: Are hover effects on movie posters properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether posters have the specified hover effects: white border appears AND scaling effect is present. Transitions should be smooth (300-500ms). Verify that the effects don't cause layout shifts or interfere with other elements. Deduct 5 points if only one effect is implemented, 3 points if transitions are jerky or cause layout issues. Full score for smooth, properly implemented hover effects with both required features.

checklist.title: Is the movie details page functionality complete?
checklist.description: Check if clicking a poster properly navigates to a details page. Verify the details page contains: embedded trailer video (functional player), plot introduction, cast list, and other relevant movie information. Navigation should be smooth with proper state management. Deduct 5 points if video embedding is missing/broken, 3 points if cast information is incomplete, and 3 points if navigation causes page reloads instead of using client-side routing. Give 10 points for complete implementation with smooth transitions.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing poster images, failed API calls, incorrect data formats, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animated transitions between pages 2. Movie rating/review system 3. Personalized recommendation feature 4. Theme customization options). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to load movie data) 2. Function modules unrelated to movie information display (e.g., unnecessary social media features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down page loading). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating components, services, and styles), code organization, and build process. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated or documented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic starry sky and film strip background implemented professionally?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the background successfully creates a cinematic atmosphere with starry sky and film strip effects. Check if animations are smooth without causing performance issues. The background should be subtle enough not to distract from the main content. Deduct 5 points if only one effect is implemented (either stars or film strip), 3 points if animations cause performance issues, and 5 points if the background overwhelms the content. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
